item.title: Human POO next to Bus Stop!, 21st October
item.description:
Very large pile of what appears to be human excrement, just next to the bus stop - to the left of the seat, but outside of the shelter itself!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham High Street, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scooter related flytipping, 21st October
item.description:
Pile of scooter related debris plus medical waste dumped in the park just behind the boathouse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Toxic chemical usage - causing residential health issue, 21st October
item.description:
Neighbour at no 7 montpellier square, has workmen using toxic chemicals - they are in heavy duty breathing masks - no warning and the chemical useage is high causing induced asthma responses. We have video of workman and van...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Montpelier Square, Knightsbridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway blocked by garden waste, 21st October
item.description:
Bushes have been cut and the trimmings left discarded blocking most of the pathway for days. Lots of the branches have thorns.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked glass in noticeboard, 21st October
item.description:
The noticeboard was paid for by Council Local Parades Grant and has now deteriorated. As the glass is cracked the notices suffer from condensation

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Avenue, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Tar graffiti bonded to the ground, 21st October
item.description:
This appeared recently and appears to be bonded to the pavement. i've seen the docks' wildlife trying to eat the raised material and the contents of the writing are offensive

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Quay, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: 78 anerley park residents, 21st October
item.description:
78 anerley park residents keep fly tipping rubbish on the pavement. Please sort it out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Evidence of living in the woods, 21st October
item.description:
Evidence of someone having been living in the woods with chairs, sofa, bedding and bags of domestic refuse scattered everywhere around. This is within a small copse at the top of the park and would normally be screened by leaves on the trees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and filth along anerley park, 21st October
item.description:
Constant build up of leaves litter and detritus along anerley park. Why is this never cleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, High Street, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken pedestrian crossing. Since MAY, 21st October
item.description:
This is still not fixed over FIVE MONTHS since the original report. How is this possible??? I am honestly shocked nobody has been killed at this crossing yet. You are aware there are dropped curbs and dimples guiding vulnerable people to cross here yet the island has been smashed to pieces? It’s absolutely shambolic and residents deserve better. Where is our council tax being spent exactly ?? Numerous residents have reported this and absolutely zero has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, High Street, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many leaves from the surrounding trees, 21st October
item.description:
Street Cleaning is due in Rushmore Close which always get left out, compared to neighbouring roads. Due to the large amount of fallen leaves from the surrounding tree's this has now made a trip / fall hazard and made the highway slippery for road users thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushmore Close, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
